string.value: It's a dangerous place. I don't want to get into this swamp without an important reason.
This seems to be the place Homer was talking about. I'll try to cross the swamp here.
The old man was right, there was a solid bottom beneath the layer of mud. I wonder what is waiting for me on the other side?
GUARD|Do not approach! Any suspicious actions will be considered as aggression!
You carry the cargo I need. I will pay you generously for it.
GUARD|Attempted bribery of an official in the line of duty!
Looks like I'm going to have to do this the hard way. Free the prisoner and get the hell out of here. You won't get a second chance.
GUARD|Everyone to the guns! Let's show that impudent man how to mess with the officers of the law!
You chose to do it yourself. The main thing is not to hit the trailer with the prisoner. The rest can burn in flames!
What are you waiting for? Get in my truck. Hurry, they could have called for help.
LEADER|Thank you for freeing me, stranger. But what are your motives? I'm not sure I can trust you.
I made a deal with your men that I would free you in exchange for the one thing I needed. And they had better hold up their part of the bargain!
Unfortunately, the prisoner's trailer got exploded in the heat of the moment. He's dead, and I have nothing to offer the extremists...
CLAW|Forbidden Zone!
Oh, my God! What the...? Why did the people of Old World need such machines?
This monster guards the passage to the Sea Gate. I need to find a way to defeat it... I'm not sure if regular bullets will work on its body.
This is the place that Homer mentioned, but I don't see any gate. Was it all for nothing?!
What's that coming out of the water? I just killed one monster and another one's on the way... This one's a little calmer, though.
It seems he's inviting me into his jaws. So this is the Sea Gate! In the belly of the beast I will swim to the Oracle. It's scary, of course... Well, I've got nothing to lose. Only forward!
Do you wish to leave this area?
There's something out there in the distance. That statue... Why is it there? Who built it there? I don't understand...
Lisa, do you copy? Can you hear me?
LISA|Yeah, it's intermittent, but I can hear you. How's the search going?
It looks like the road to the frozen lands really starts here. I'm trying to get some warm clothes, and we're going to need some explosives, too.
LISA|Explosives? What for?
The tunnel leading there is blocked by the rocks. And it looks like Ivan did it himself.
LISA|Got it. I'll get the explosives and come straight to you. Over and out.
That's a lot of stuff in here. Yep, there's clothes, I think. Well, I hope it fits.
Well, not bad at all.
LISA|You look great, fancy man.
You're just jealous that I got to the storage earlier and got the best of everything.
LISA|Yes, with black envy. All right, let's see what we have here.
LISA|Wow! I've only seen these in pictures!
LISA|It's nice and warm! I'm ready! What now?
The most essential part is left - to clear the tunnel.
LISA|I have explosives, that should be enough. Show me the way.
Lisa, get away, I'm lighting the fuse!
LISA|It seemed to work. And how impressive, too!
All right, the way is cleared. I don't know what awaits us on the other side, but I'm ready!
LISA|Me too. Let's go!
SQUAD LEADER|So, you all know what to do! Full throttle, first the pillboxes, then the guards! Let's show them how to mess with the northern traders!
The storage is cleared, the work is done! Now it's time to check out what's in this warehouse at all.

MASTER DOKA|This is the master from Midgard, over. I ordered the covers, and the merchant left them in the ruins of the old city in Vaterland, I'm sending the coordinates. Be careful, they say the "Brigade" bandits were seen there.
Got it. I've got the composite, so I'll pick up the covers and drive up to Midgard. Be ready to get to work. Over and out.
Try to cross the swamp?
It's a dangerous place. It's risky to go into this swamp at random, but I can't afford to waste time questioning the locals. I'll try to drive around the edge.
Damn it, I think the wheels are stuck in the mud! Come on, come on! Come on! Come on!
No! No! No! It can't end like this! It can't! It can't...
After what I've done here, I think it's safer to go through the Druid islands.
Here comes the iron bird. And what is to be resolved here?
Let's check the cabin. There's something in here. Some kind of book. "Confirmation of the instant evolution theory". I think that's what I need.
There's a signature. "Author... ...better known in the new world as Ivan Go."
IVAN GO|Hello, son.

Confirmation of the instant evolution theory||...In the course of my research, I was able to find definitive and credible arguments in favor of the theory of evolutionary leapfrogging, however paradoxical it might be. Most people really could not accept this gift, permanently settled in cities, and still desperately grasping for the crumbs of their former lives.||But there are exceptions. They, who also don't understand what they are up against, try to behave like the most ordinary people, but there is great potential in them themselves. They are the ones who manage to break the shackles of the daily routine, leave their homes, and travel the world.||At first everything seems normal to them, but the more they observe the world from the outside, the stronger their sense of unreality, of the artificiality of what is happening. Then they begin to search for answers, and this search leads them to the Overlord, who takes them for himself forever.||However, the author of this theory was wrong about one thing. No living human could die, no matter what happened to him. After the activation of the device inside the Overlord (as the Madmen call him), time itself stopped existing on this planet, and, therefore, the concept of death underwent strong changes.

Of course, because people still hold the old conceptions of death, a person who dies in front of their eyes will be considered dead by them, but he himself will not die, but, instantly forgetting his death, will continue to do what he was doing before. It is just that other people will stop noticing him.||It is the same with physiological needs. The new people are not hungry, thirsty, hot, cold, suffering from any disease or injury. Yes, they can still freeze from the cold, sweat from the heat and die from supposedly deadly diseases, but it all happens only in their heads according to the same algorithm I described above.||With emotions it is much more complicated. As I was able to find out, the mental state of new people is directly affected by the downed ship. In its immediate surroundings (Vahat and Zarmek), people are excessively aggressive, their minds are clouded, and their thinking is confused. In my opinion, this is explained by the Overlord's defense mechanism, whose main purpose is to protect himself by preventing intruders from entering Zarmek.

On the other side of the fallen ship lies the Mountains of the Wise, with a radically different situation. Whereas in the Desert, the locals force strangers away from the crash site, the peaceful snowy landscapes themselves dispose anyone in the region to abandon all their goals and stay there forever. Very few are able to resist the strange energy of this place, which the locals call the "Grace". It is, as we see it, a very different mechanism for protecting the Overlord from strangers.||The mind of people in other regions is almost completely unaffected by the Overlord. The reason for this behavior is unknown - either the inhabitants of distant lands pose no danger to it, or it simply cannot influence such long distances.||It is also extremely important to mention the two sides of the conflict surrounding the Overlord. On one side is the Njeri race, to which the Overlord directly belongs. On the other side is an artificial intelligence calling itself the Oracle. Njeri pursue the goal of keeping humanity in check, preventing the final accomplishment of the evolutionary leap mentioned earlier. The Oracle's goal is the complete destruction of the Overlord, which will do more harm than good.||But how can we, ordinary people, get out of this difficult situation? There is only one way out: waiting. Waiting for someone who, having learned the whole truth, will not go crazy, will realize his otherness and break free from the shackles of a familiar, but now non-existent life.
IVAN GO|You were right - it really is a beautiful place.
IVAN GO|You know, sometimes I catch myself thinking that we no longer exist in the universe.
How's that?

IVAN GO|It seems to me that we are in a kind of Purgatory. Not metaphorically, but really in biblical Purgatory. A place where our souls are imprisoned in the shackles of an ever-repeating existence. A place where there is no time, no need, and no death.
It's kind of like that.

IVAN GO|And our souls are doomed to sit in the same place and do the same things. Sometimes there are strong souls who are able to break free from these chains. There are also those who must hinder such souls and lead them down the path - the Oracle and Njeri.
IVAN GO|And at the end of the path, when no one has broken you, you take off the mask and release your soul.
I wish I could believe that. But it's too simple an explanation.
IVAN GO|Who knows...
I am ready. I feel that there is no fear in me anymore. Father, I don't know what will come next, but whatever happens, don't tell anyone about it. For their sake.
IVAN GO|It's the least I can do for you.
Well, let's not hesitate any longer. On the count of three. One... Two...
And I wonder how Tikhomir and Dobroslava are doing. I'll probably have to pay them a visit on my way to Vaterland.
Password for the bonus ending: ******z********|For more information, read the mod's manual.
Password for the bonus ending: *******Q*******|For more information, read the mod's manual.
Password for the bonus ending: ********v******|For more information, read the mod's manual.
